thread.title: Orange and White series set to start
thread.title_full: Orange and White series set to start

title: Orange and White series set to start
text:
Orange and White series caps fall baseball News Sentinel staff 11:32 PM, Oct 24, 2015   Show Caption Previous Next 
Tennessee baseball's Orange and White World Series begins Sunday at Lindsey Nelson Stadium at 12:30 p.m. 
The intrasquad, best-of-five series will continue Tuesday, Thursday, Saturday and Sunday, with the final game marking the end of the fall practice session and Tennessee Baseball Family Day for team members. 
All games are open to the public. Times for the other games will be announced Monday. 
Tennessee also will host its second annual Vol Baseball Halloween Extravaganza at 4:30 p.m. on Friday. The team will hold an open practice and intrasquad scrimmage in which players and coaches will be dressed in Halloween costumes of their choice. 
Gates open at 3 p.m. Following the scrimmage, fans will be allowed to tour the baseball facilities, meet team members and participate in trick-or-treating. The event is free and fans are encouraged to wear costumes. They also are encouraged to park in the GF1 and C1 parking lots located behind Fraternity Row. 
Rowing: Tennessee sent two novice boats to the Secret City Head Race on the Tennessee River in Oak Ridge on Saturday. 
Tennessee finished second and fourth in the women's Novice 8+ race. The first boat finished in 22 minutes, 31.6 seconds while the other boat clocked in at 24:08.1. 
Murray State won the race with a 21:58.4 time while Vanderbilt finished in third place with a mark of 23:22.6. Chattanooga finished fifth with a time of 24:51.7. 
This was the first race for the group of Vols novices who began rowing for the first time last month. 
"The novices had a good first race experience today in Oak Ridge," UT coach Lisa Glenn said. "We are looking forward to each of the exciting next steps they will take as they develop their rowing skill and endurance." 
The Vols will be back in action on November 7, when the team competes at the Head of the Hooch in Chattanooga. 
Men's Tennis: Two Tennessee doubles teams won to advance to the top-flight semifinals of the SEC Fall Classic in Auburn, Ala. 
Junior Jack Schipanski and sophomore Luis Valero, who played No. 3 doubles for the Vols last year, beat Vanderbilt's Baker Newman and Ryan Smith, 8-6. Sophomores Igor Smelyanski and Preston Touliatos beat No. 2 seeds Harrison O'Keefe and Thomas Mayronne of South Carolina, 8-6. 
Luis Valero was the only UT player to advance in singles, beating Florida's McClain Kessler, 6-3, 7-6. The Vols' sophomore lost his semifinal match to Mississippi State's Rishab Agarwal 6-3, 7-6. 
Smelyanski and Jack Heslin both lost their quarterfinal matches. Smelyanski lost to Mayronne 6-4, 7-6, in the A draw.
